channel.title: Cointelegraph.com News
channel.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest news and analyses on the future of money.

image.title: Cointelegraph.com News
image.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest news and analyses on the future of money.

item.title: What is crypto copy trading and how does it work?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Dilip Kumar Patairya
item.description: Crypto copy trading enables traders to replicate the trades of expert traders and get over the steep learning curve. Find how crypto copy trading works.

item.title: Polygon Studios' Ryan Watt talks Web3's core principles and fairer internet
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Arijit Sarkar
item.description: Ryan Wyatt, the CEO of Polygon Studios, shares his thoughts on blockchain upgrades and his plans for Polygon in supporting the upcoming Web3 disruption.

item.title: Here's why Binance's CZ invested in Twitter following Elon Musk acquisition
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Arijit Sarkar
item.description: “Free speech is a prerequisite for having freedom of money, which we are building for,” said CZ, highlighting the importance of Twitter as a platform to voice opinions.

item.title: Automation opens up pathway to a simplified, more user-friendly DeFi
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Chris Jones
item.description: Hunting for the best opportunities in the world of DeFi is often time consuming. But automation is changing that.

item.title: Bitcoin is now less volatile than S&P 500 and Nasdaq
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: A rare 2% daily loss for the U.S. dollar index gives Bitcoin and stocks an opportunity for gains, but BTC still undercuts the rest on volatility.

item.title: Joe Biden unhappy with Elon Musk for buying a platform that "spews lies"
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Arijit Sarkar
item.description: Biden attended a fundraising event in Chicago for upcoming elections, wherein he called out Elon Musk for purchasing Twitter.

item.title: Ethereum inches even closer to total censorship due to OFAC compliance
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Arijit Sarkar
item.description: The minting of OFAC-compliant Ethereum blocks on a daily basis has grown to 73%, adding to the community's growing censorship concerns.

item.title: Web3 Foundation makes bold claim to SEC: 'DOT is not a security. It is merely software'
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: According to CLO Daniel Schoenberger, the team developed a “workable theory of how token morphing may be achieved” for DOT based on the SEC’s concerns and federal securities laws.

item.title: CBDCs are a declaration of war against the banking system claims economist
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: Richard Werner discusses decentralization's challenges and blockchain's role in it in an exclusive interview with Cointelegraph.

item.title: OCC makes its staff available for fintech-related discussions
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: The announcement of one-on-one discussions with the OCC followed the department saying it planned to establish an Office of Financial Technology starting in 2023.

item.title: Is Bitcoin bullish or nah? Here is what is really going on with BTC price
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Big Smokey
item.category: is the crypto bull market back
is crypto in a bear market
item.description: Data suggests BTC is finally carving out a bottom, but is it time to buy?

item.title: FX spot settlement in 10 seconds: NY Fed releases results of wholesale CBDC research
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: Project Cedar successfully used custom distributed ledger technology to settle hypothetical transactions quickly “from the perspective of the Federal Reserve.”

item.title: JPMorgan executes first DeFi trade on a public blockchain: Finance Redefined
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Prashant Jha
item.description: MakerDAO co-founder Nikolai Mushegian's death opened a new Pandora's box of conspiracy theories, based on some of his recent tweets.

item.title: Inflation is killing us; cryptocurrency alone cannot beat it
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By James Song
item.description: Traditional currencies are failing, and research has shown that cryptocurrencies may be susceptible to the same shortcomings.

item.title: Traders expect 200% upside from MATIC, but does Polygon network data support that?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Kyle White
item.description: MATIC’s recent rally and partnerships are turning heads and on-chain activity may hint at further growth.

item.title: Tattoo industry expands into the NFT space amid digital culture shift
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: Nonfungible tokens may be an option for maximizing monetization and exposure for a tattoo artists' work.

item.title: Why is Bitcoin price up today?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Kyle White
item.category: Why is Bitcoin price up today
why is the crypto market up today
is the federal reserve going to pivot
item.description: Bitcoin, altcoins and stocks rallied after data showed United States payrolls surged, but is the current bullish momentum sustainable?

item.title: Crypto Biz: Was Celsius just a Ponzi after all?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Sam Bourgi
item.description: The bankrupt crypto lender has been accused by customers of being a Ponzi. Meanwhile, Binance's $500 million investment in Elon Musk's Twitter has been confirmed.

item.title: How to transfer $1 billion for basically free: Bitcoin whale watching
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Joseph Hall
item.description: At just 15 sats/vByte, a Bitcoin user is demonstrating just how cheap it is to send vast sums of money across the internet.

item.title: UK lawmakers open inquiry into NFT regulation — 'there are fears that the bubble may burst'
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: According to the DCMS committee, NFT regulation in the U.K. is “largely non-existent,” with lawmakers planning to assess the assets ahead of a review by the treasury department.

item.title: Dogecoin trader explains why shorting DOGE now makes sense
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Yashu Gola
item.description: Independent market analyst GCR will short Dogecoin even more if Elon Musk goes ahead with his plans to add DOGE payments to Twitter.

item.title: Why are institutions accumulating crypto in 2022? Fidelity researcher explains
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Marco Castrovilli
item.description: Institutional involvement in crypto, especially in Ethereum, has increased in 2022 despite the bear market, according to the latest findings of a Fidelity Digital Assets survey.

item.title: Why is the crypto market up today?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: Bitcoin price is back at highs from mid-September, and BTC bulls have staged another attack on $21,000. Here are three reasons why the crypto markets are surging.

item.title: Bitcoin sets new 7-week high as BTC price jumps past $21K on US jobs
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: Just like that, BTC price action marks its highest levels since mid-September as U.S. unemployment data hints Fed rate hikes are working.

item.title: Elrond rebrands as MultiversX, shifts focus to the metaverse
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Savannah Fortis
item.description: The blockchain developer announced it will transform into MultiversX, as it shifts focus to metaverse development and introduces three new products.

item.title: WhatsApp crash: Are decentralized blockchain messengers a real alternative?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Erhan Kahraman
item.description: Centralized communication apps share one crucial feature: They crash often. Cointelegraph investigates to see if decentralization can offer a solution.

item.title: US Election update: Where do the pro-crypto candidates stand ahead of the election?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: Crypto has been highly visible in this election cycle thanks to polls and political action committees. This is a new and unaccustomed role for it with unknown results.

item.title: Web Summit Lisbon, Nov. 4: Latest updates from Cointelegraph’s ground team
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Prashant Jha
item.description: It’s the final day of Web Summit 2022, and the Cointelegraph team on the ground is all set to bring you some of the best insights, personal interviews and more.

item.title: IRS prepares for an increase in crypto cases in the upcoming tax season
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Savannah Fortis
item.description: The criminal investigation division of the IRS says it is preparing hundreds of crypto-related cases for the upcoming tax season.

item.title: Bitcoin bulls face $21K sellers as BTC price wipes out Fed FOMC losses
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: $21,000 is looking tricky as sell orders mount, while buy walls dry up, taking potential support with them.
